result.execSummary:
One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. George Bennett is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

On one or more charges in this case, George Bennett was found not guilty by reason of mental disease or defect. The defendant was found guilty of actually committing the crime(s) charged, but was also found not to be legally responsible under Wis. Stats. 971.165 for committing the crime(s) because of the defendant's mental condition. The legal effect of a finding of not guilty by reason of mental disease or defect is that the court must commit the defendant to the custody of the Department of Health and Family Services.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Defendant in court with Attorney Reed Cornia.  AAG Jeffrey Mark Gabrysiak appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court orders jury instructions due 6-6-16 by 5pm. Motion to withdraw as counsel filed. Atty Cornia advises client/atty relationship is broken. AAG Gabrysiak objects to motion to withdraw. Court DENIES motion. Defn has S/C docs against Attys Watson and Cornia. Court admonishes defn not to file S/C case. AAG Gabrysiak offers plea to dismiss Ct 1 and Ct 4 in exchange for joint stip to NGI plea on Cts 2 and 3, 3 years and 2 mos commitment to Dept of Health Svcs. Court breaks at 4:02 pm to allow parties to discuss plea. Court resumes at 4:13 pm. Defn would like 2002 case re-opened and dismissed and to option to re-open and dismiss this case at conclusion. Court would hear motion in future, but cannot advise on outcome. Defn accepts plea. Parties stipulate to NGI plea. SEH 6-20-16 @ 8:30 am. State may withdraw witnesses, no motions will be accepted after today. Bond continued
and proposed order to withdraw as counsel
by Anthony Jurek PhD.. Copies to attys and judge.

Defendant in court with Attorney Kim Marie Zion. Jeffrey Mark Gabrysiak appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Motion for attorney withdrawal. DE would like SPD appointment. Atty Zion reports DE has been approved for SPD and does not object to motion. State takes no position as to motion to withdraw. Court sets case for trial week of 6/6/16. Court grants motion to withdraw with understanding that SPD will be taking over representation. If SPD does not take over representation, Atty Zion is to remain on the case. DE will not be granted any further attorney withdrawals. Trial dates will not be rescheduled. By 2/9/16,  SPD to notify Court of new attorney and confirmation that SPD is aware of trial dates and State to inform court if new evaluation is requested.

Defendant George Bennett in court with attorney Mark Eisenberg for Kim M. Zion. Prosecuting Atty Jeffrey Mark Gabrysiak appeared for State of Wisconsin with Detective Chris Grunewald.  Atty Eisenberg raises the issue of competency again.  Defn does not to do another evaluation.  STATE: postition is that a hearing was already held on this.  COURT: reviews previously filed evaluation. Believes raising the issue on the day of preliminary heairng is tardy.  ATTY Eisenberg: will proceed today but wants record to show he raised issue.  STATE: moves to orally amend complain. Dates for counts 2, 3, and 4 are incorrect. Correct dates are btwn 6-6 and 6-9-2014.  Court grants.  
STATE: calls Det Grunewald, duly sworn. Direct.  Ex 1 marked, id'd.  Cross Exam.  Ex. 1 offered, and received.  State moves for bind over without argument.  Defense's argument.

Defendant in court, in custody with Attorney Hal Harlowe.  David A Hart appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defense moves to dismiss Count 2. State objects to motion to dismiss Count 2. Court denies oral motion. The Court has reviewed the Complaint, makes a finding of probable cause and  ORDERS A COMPETENCY EVALUATION  pursuant to Wis. Stats. 971.14.  The Dept of Health & Family Services shall examine the defendant's mental competency to proceed.  Hearing scheduled for July 8, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
